2018-07-29T15:12:53Z: That's it for Autosport Live today, stayed tuned to Autosport.com and Motorsport.com for all the breaking news from the paddock at the Hungaroring.We'll see you back here for FP1 and the Belgian Grand Prix on Friday 24 August - have a good (almost) four weeks!
2018-07-29T15:11:10Z: Here’s our race report from the Hungarian Grand Prix, which was dominated by Lewis Hamilton. Hungarian Grand Prix report: Hamilton wins, Bottas hits VettelLewis Hamilton extended his Formula 1 world championship lead with victory in the Hungarian Grand Prix, as Sebastian Vettel survived late contact with Valtteri Bottas to finish second
2018-07-29T14:54:45Z: It does, he leaps out, salutes the crowd and jumps into the arms of his team.
2018-07-29T14:54:22Z: Hamilton opts to remove his helmet before getting out of the car - it's a bold strategy, let's see if it pays off for him.
2018-07-29T14:53:49Z: Hamilton arrives in parc ferme and gently noses the number one board.
2018-07-29T14:52:26Z: Outside the points: 11 Hartley; 12 Hulkenberg; 13 Ocon; 14 Perez; 15 Ericsson; 16 Sirotkin; 17 Stroll
2018-07-29T14:52:02Z: Result: 1 Hamilton; 2 Vettel; 3 Raikkonen; 4 Ricciardo; 5 Bottas; 6 Gasly; 7 Magnussen; 8 Alonso; 9 Sainz; 10 Grosjean
2018-07-29T14:50:42Z: Vettel and Raikkonen clinch second and third places.
2018-07-29T14:50:34Z: Meanwhile, Hamilton wins the Hungarian Grand Prix and builds a 24-point championship lead!
2018-07-29T14:50:11Z: Ricciardo does make it past Bottas smoothly this time to take fourth.
2018-07-29T14:50:00Z: That seems over-cautious from Mercedes, as Ricciardo wasn't actually ahead of Bottas at that point, but it is very polite.
2018-07-29T14:49:17Z: Ricciardo is back to within 0.6s of Bottas ready for another go.
2018-07-29T14:48:44Z: Race control is going to investigate the Bottas/Ricciardo touch after the race.
2018-07-29T14:48:32Z: Ricciardo was going round the outside of Bottas, wasn't quite ahead, and Bottas locked up at Turn 1 and whacked the Red Bull, sending it wide and over the run-off area.
2018-07-29T14:47:55Z: Vettel is having a bit of a punt, setting his best lap yet and getting Hamilton's lead down to 20s, but with only two laps left.
2018-07-29T14:47:33Z: Bottas gets going first, with damage on both cars. They're 37s clear of Gasly behind.
2018-07-29T14:47:15Z: More contact for Bottas - he hits Ricciardo as the Red Bull tries to go around the outside!
2018-07-29T14:46:54Z: And indeed Hulkenberg has passed Ocon for P12.
2018-07-29T14:46:48Z: Ricciardo is right behind Bottas and trying to drive around the outside of him.
2018-07-29T14:46:42Z: Hulkenberg is right with Ocon - the battle we've all been waiting for over P12 is on!
2018-07-29T14:46:28Z: Bottas had got a massive amount of oversteer out of Turn 1 on his worn tyres as that incident began, allowing Vettel to out-accelerate him and then take the position, at which point Bottas clipped some grass, locked up and thumped the Ferrari.
2018-07-29T14:45:36Z: So with four laps to go, Hamilton has a 23.5s lead over Vettel with Raikkonen surely now sitting tight in a dutiful third. Bottas's damaged car is just 1.3s ahead of Ricciardo.
2018-07-29T14:44:30Z: Bottas is staying out but is only 3.7s ahead of Ricciardo now.
2018-07-29T14:44:17Z: That was quite a hard hit from Bottas into the back of Vettel, and happened when the move was basically all over already.
2018-07-29T14:43:36Z: There's wing damage for Bottas, who falls to fourth behind Raikkonen straight away.
2018-07-29T14:43:23Z: Vettel had tried to the outside at Turn 1, then cut across and made it through into Turn 2 but he gets a hit from the Mercedes as he completes the move.
2018-07-29T14:43:04Z: Vettel and Bottas make contact as Vettel finally makes it through at Turn 2!
2018-07-29T14:42:35Z: And Hamilton's lead is up to 23.5s.
2018-07-29T14:42:04Z: Ricciardo is setting his best times of the day so far, but at 12s behind the Bottas train he won't have time to get involved with seven laps left.
2018-07-29T14:41:27Z: Vettel gets very, very close to Bottas under braking for Turn 1.
2018-07-29T14:40:25Z: Vettel is closer than ever to Bottas but still cannot find a way past.
2018-07-29T14:39:47Z: In the scrap for the Class B win, Gasly's lead over Magnussen in sixth place is down to just 5.7s, which is still healthy, but it was over 10s a little while back.
2018-07-29T14:38:30Z: Hulkenberg has now dropped back to 2s behind Ocon, so no fight for P12 just yet. Devastating news.
2018-07-29T14:37:25Z: And while all his chasers queue keep behind each other, Hamilton is cruising around with an 18s lead.
2018-07-29T14:36:59Z: Bottas now has both Vettel and Raikkonen right behind him with 10 laps to go.
2018-07-29T14:36:25Z: Hulkenberg is just 0.4s behind Ocon in P13.
2018-07-29T14:33:25Z: Everyone up to Magnussen in seventh place has been lapped.
2018-07-29T14:32:55Z: Raikkonen is now just 3s behind Bottas and Vettel.
2018-07-29T14:32:03Z: Even if Vettel can get past Bottas, Hamilton is now 15s clear in the lead with 14 laps to go.
2018-07-29T14:31:43Z: Bottas tells Mercedes the rear tyres are still in trouble now.
2018-07-29T14:30:43Z: Hulkenberg, who stopped for fresh ultrasofts under the VSC, has passed Perez for 13th at Turn 1.
2018-07-29T14:30:07Z: Raikkonen is absolutely flying behind Bottas and Vettel too, now just 5.3s behind them.
2018-07-29T14:29:25Z: Bottas locks up and Vettel is closer than ever.
2018-07-29T14:28:47Z: Bottas is on 38-lap-old softs, Vettel on 14-lap-old ultrasofts and they're nose to tail with 16 laps left.
2018-07-29T14:27:56Z: Hello again Vettel, he closes to within DRS range of Bottas once more. Seventeen laps to go...
2018-07-29T14:27:25Z: Ferrari's heartbreak moment - Bottas sweeps past as Vettel rejoins third
2018-07-29T14:27:20Z: Vandoorne's exit has promoted Sainz to ninth and Grosjean to 10th.
2018-07-29T14:26:51Z: With the gaps resettling after the VSC, it now looks like this: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +12.6s; 3 Vettel +13.9s; 4 Raikkonen +23.0s; 5 Ricciardo +37.4s
2018-07-29T14:25:11Z: That's a real shame for Vandoorne - he was on for ninth, right behind team-mate Alonso.
2018-07-29T14:24:52Z: Mercedes gets ready in the pitlane just in case a stop is the right move in this VSC moment, though it's not clear why it would be.
2018-07-29T14:24:13Z: Vandoorne pulls over at the exit of Turn 1 - he's out of the race.
2018-07-29T14:23:49Z: There's a VSC for the slowing McLaren.
2018-07-29T14:23:01Z: Stroll has pitted to switch from the mediums to the ultrasofts, so all the drivers have now made at least one stop. The Williams driver is now last, 17s behind team-mate Sirotkin.
2018-07-29T14:22:44Z: OK, Vettel is back on it - he's just done his two personal best laps of the race, and is back within 1.3s of Bottas.
2018-07-29T14:21:10Z: Replays show that Grosjean was so angry at being shuffled down the order that he ran off the track at Turn 12. That won't show them, Romain.
2018-07-29T14:20:15Z: Vettel just doesn't seem to have any pace at the moment - he's fallen 2.8s away from Bottas, and is 13.7s off Vettel up front.
2018-07-29T14:19:17Z: Ricciardo is doing what you'd expect Ricciardo to do on new ultrasofts: a new fastest lap of 1m20.012s. But with a 14s gap to Raikkonen ahead, can he do anything more than finish fifth?
2018-07-29T14:17:09Z: Ocon has used his fresher ultrasoft tyres to repass Perez for 14th in the intra-Force India battle.
2018-07-29T14:16:49Z: Lead gaps on lap 45 of 70: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +9.1s; 3 Vettel +10.9s; 4 Raikkonen +25.7s; 5 Ricciardo +40.4s
2018-07-29T14:16:26Z: Christian Horner slams Renault for the sub-par service after Verstappen retired in Hungaryautosport.com/f1/news/137725…
2018-07-29T14:16:13Z: Raikkonen is back up to fourth thanks to Ricciardo's pitstop. He's setting very fast times, but has a 16s gap to the Bottas/Vettel fight.
2018-07-29T14:15:40Z: Vettel has fallen 1.9s away from Bottas now.
2018-07-29T14:15:17Z: Ricciardo finally makes his first pitstop after lap 44, swapping to ultrasofts and rejoining fifth.
2018-07-29T14:13:39Z: Vettel is lurking within DRS range of Bottas but struggling to get close enough to actually try anything.
2018-07-29T14:12:59Z: Another fastest lap from Raikkonen, a 1m21.278s, getting his gap to Ricciardo down to 8.8s.
2018-07-29T14:12:31Z: Gasly, the top Class B runner, is circulating virtually himself, 22-seconds behind Raikkonen and 11s ahead of Magnussen.
2018-07-29T14:11:29Z: And Vandoorne has rejoined in ninth place, which means both McLarens have jumped Sainz, Grosjean, Hartley and Hulkenberg and are legitimately in contention for points.
2018-07-29T14:11:14Z: Raikkonen puts in a new fastest lap of 1m21.381s. He's now 10.9s behind Ricciardo, who has to pit still, and is 20s off the Bottas/Vettel battle.
2018-07-29T14:10:33Z: Will Bottas want to stop again as Raikkonen has? He's done 25 laps on his current softs, but Ricciardo is still making his work after starting on them 40 laps ago.
2018-07-29T14:10:24Z: Vandoorne pits from what was eighth.
2018-07-29T14:10:09Z: Alonso has rejoined in ninth on the medium tyres ahead of Sainz and Grosjean in ninth place, while Ocon is now 15th and behind Perez, who was stuck behind the other Force India in the early stages.
2018-07-29T14:10:03Z: Vettel is immediately right up with Bottas and attacking hard for second place with 30 laps still to go.
2018-07-29T14:09:48Z: Lead gaps now: 1 Hamilton (1 stop); 2 Bottas +8.3s (1 stop); 3 Vettel +8.8s (1 stop); 4 Ricciardo +18.1s (0 stops); 5 Raikkonen +31.2s (2 stops)
2018-07-29T14:09:03Z: Bottas had seemed to be drifting away completely, but banged in the two fastest laps of the race so far just as Vettel's lap times on his old softs faded away.
2018-07-29T14:08:26Z: Vettel takes on ultrasofts but it's not a good stop, and that plus a sudden burst of fastest-lap-setting speed from Bottas means he falls to third!
2018-07-29T14:07:48Z: Vettel now pits from the lead.
2018-07-29T14:07:36Z: Raikkonen falls to fifth, and rejoins on some used softs.
2018-07-29T14:05:34Z: Vettel's softs have surely had enough. Not helped by traffic either, his gap suddenly begins to tumble - now just 9.3s.
2018-07-29T14:05:18Z: McLaren has told Alonso that he has in fact cleared Grosjean.
2018-07-29T14:03:54Z: Sirotkin's stop as put him back behind Ericsson at the rear of the field.
2018-07-29T14:03:04Z: Ricciardo's progress towards Bottas and Raikkonen - which is a bit of a tease anyway as he still has a pitstop to make - has slowed a bit and he is now 5.2s behind.
2018-07-29T14:02:30Z: Ocon is running 10th, but he's yet to stop.
2018-07-29T14:02:22Z: Vettel's lead dwindles a little further, down to 12.3s. He's in no danger of losing second to Bottas now as his gap back to the second Mercedes is up to 24.5s and Raikkonen is keeping Bottas occupied.
2018-07-29T14:01:49Z: Gasly has stopped and maintained his sixth place, but he's now on the soft tyres.
2018-07-29T13:59:58Z: Another better lap from Hamilton brings Vettel's lead down to 13.6s.
2018-07-29T13:59:39Z: TWO McLARENS ARE RUNNING IN THE POINTS - THIS IS NOT A DRILL. But Alonso (seventh) and Vandoorne (eighth) are yet to stop.
2018-07-29T13:59:31Z: With Raikkonen around DRS range behind Bottas now, Ricciardo is lapping a second quicker than both and is within 4s of Raikkonen's tail.
2018-07-29T13:58:54Z: Hamilton was slightly quicker than Vettel last time around, pegging the gap at 13.8s.
2018-07-29T13:58:48Z: Magnussen stops for softs, but is held up by a slow change on the left-front.
2018-07-29T13:58:21Z: Raikkonen is now right on Bottas's tail for third.
2018-07-29T13:57:02Z: Gasly and Magnussen now the only ultrasoft-shod runners.
2018-07-29T13:56:27Z: Replays show Perez did a Ricciardo and dived-bombed Stroll down the inside of Turn 1 for 16th.
2018-07-29T13:55:57Z: Lead gaps: 1 Vettel; 2 Hamilton +14.6s; 3 Bottas +23.8s; 4 Raikkonen +25.4s; 5 Ricciardo +31.4s
2018-07-29T13:55:39Z: Grosjean pits for soft tyres - he rejoins 12th and has jumped Hartley and Hulkenberg.
2018-07-29T13:55:35Z: Meanwhile Raikkonen has closed to within 1.9s of Bottas, and Ricciardo continues to charge towards both.
2018-07-29T13:54:53Z: If this pans out as Mercedes predicted, Vettel is going to emerge not far behind Hamilton and on new ultrasofts with 25 laps to go, with Hamilton on very old softs by then. Still doesn't look like a bad position for Ferrari.
2018-07-29T13:53:54Z: After that initial strong lap from Hamilton, Vettel is getting away from him again this time around - the lead advantage back up to 13.1s.
2018-07-29T13:53:49Z: Hulkenberg and Hartley, 14th and 13th thanks to their stops, are the next drivers in danger of being lapped.
2018-07-29T13:52:53Z: Gasly, Magnussen and Grosjean are the only drivers still circulating on the ultrasofts.
2018-07-29T13:52:51Z: A glum Verstappen heads back to the pits earlier
2018-07-29T13:52:30Z: So what can Ricciardo do from here? He's just taken a second off Bottas and Raikkonen ahead and is now 7s behind the Ferrari. But he hasn't pitted yet, and they have.
2018-07-29T13:52:10Z: It's been a tough day for Sauber, Leclerc is out and Ericsson has been at the pack of the back since his early stop.
2018-07-29T13:52:05Z: Bottas is now 21.8s behind Vettel in third. He has responded to Raikkonen looming in the distance behind him and stabilised that gap at 3s for now.
2018-07-29T13:51:37Z: As he gets up to speed on his new softs, Hamilton does a new fastest lap of 1m21.968s and reduces Vettel's lead to 12.9s.
2018-07-29T13:50:32Z: Ricciardo tries a DRS pass on Gasly, is too far back, so he outbrakes him from miles behind him. Up to fifth for the remaining Red Bull.
2018-07-29T13:50:05Z: Gaps on lap 26: 1 Vettel (yet to stop); 2 Hamilton +13.1s; 3 Bottas +21.0s; 4 Raikkonen +24.1s; 5 Gasly (yet to stop) +31.9s; 6 Ricciardo (yet to stop) +32.6s
2018-07-29T13:49:54Z: Sainz pits from eighth - he rejoins 12th on the mediums.
2018-07-29T13:49:22Z: Hartley rejoined in 13th, still one second in front of Hulkenberg,
2018-07-29T13:49:15Z: At present, it looks like a clean stop for Vettel would get him back out just ahead of Bottas in second as that gap is up to 21s.
2018-07-29T13:48:47Z: Perez passes Ericsson for P17 at Turn 1. They're a lap down already.
2018-07-29T13:48:46Z: So Vettel moves into the lead on his 25-lap old softs, with Hamilton 13s behind him on new softs.
2018-07-29T13:48:28Z: Hamilton pits and swaps ultrasofts for softs, rejoining a comfortable second behind Vettel.
2018-07-29T13:48:06Z: Hartley pits from ninth, he moves onto the mediums.
2018-07-29T13:48:00Z: Ricciardo's mission to return to the lead group is nearly complete - he's 1.1s behind fifth-placed Gasly now.
2018-07-29T13:47:45Z: Hulkenberg rejoined in P14, which means Grosjean is now 10th.
2018-07-29T13:47:43Z: Raikkonen is closing on Bottas for third - that gap was 6s and now it's down to 3.6s.
2018-07-29T13:47:06Z: A cleaner lap for Vettel this time and he reduces Hamilton's lead to 6.5s.
2018-07-29T13:46:54Z: Hulkenberg stops for medium tyres. Hopefully that solves his crap issues.
2018-07-29T13:45:58Z: Locking up and running a bit wide into the tight Turn 12 didn't help Vettel there either.
2018-07-29T13:45:40Z: Traffic is starting to feature for the leaders now and that's affecting the gap - a slower sector for Vettel means the gap is back up to 7.2s to Hamilton.
2018-07-29T13:45:34Z: Perez pits from P15 - he swaps his ultrasofts for the softs.
2018-07-29T13:44:51Z: The field is pretty spread out now - Hulkenberg to Hartley and Hulkenberg to Grosjean, both gaps around 1.2s, are the closest fights.
2018-07-29T13:44:37Z: Suddenly things are swinging Ferrari's way - Vettel was 1.5s quicker than Hamilton that time around. The lead gap is 6.3s on lap 22 with neither having pitted yet.
2018-07-29T13:44:02Z: Ricciardo has now successfully made it past Magnussen and up to 6th.
2018-07-29T13:43:41Z: Raikkonen takes fourth from yet-to-pit Gasly. Bottas is 6s ahead in third.
2018-07-29T13:43:01Z: Are Hamilton's ultrasofts starting to fade? Vettel starts gaining on him, getting the lead gap down to 7.6s.
2018-07-29T13:42:12Z: Ricciardo has to try another big lunge on Magnussen, and again the Haas is able to brake late enough.
2018-07-29T13:41:27Z: A replay catches Bottas running slightly wide out of the chicane and kicking up some dust. He's losing a bit of time to Vettel ahead now - that gap is 18s.
2018-07-29T13:41:23Z: Plenty of drivers setting personal best laps - including Hartley and Hulkenberg at the tail end of the top 10.
2018-07-29T13:40:45Z: Ricciardo can't DRS pass Magnussen so has to try an outbraking move, but the Haas holds him off at Turn 1.
2018-07-29T13:40:21Z: Ricciardo is now right on Magnussen's tail for sixth.
2018-07-29T13:40:10Z: Vettel is a touch quicker than Hamilton on the latest lap but the gap is still stubbornly 8.7s.
2018-07-29T13:39:42Z: That tweet from Ferrari explains the slight delay in the pitstop - clear some debris from the brake system.
2018-07-29T13:39:00Z: This time around, Hamilton is 0.02s faster than Vettel. There's a tyre disparity, though - Hamilton's doing those times on ultrasofts, Vettel on softs.
2018-07-29T13:38:33Z: Raikkonen has a 5s gap to close to catch the yet-to-pit Gasly. Ricciardo will soon be right with Magnussen for sixth.
2018-07-29T13:37:54Z: Ricciardo briefly held fastest lap as he reached clear air, but it was then taken by Raikkonen - who did a 1m22.046s.
2018-07-29T13:37:41Z: Bottas cruises past Gasly to take third.
2018-07-29T13:37:29Z: Vettel is now in clear air without Bottas in his way but he's not making any inroads on Hamilton ahead really - only 0.016s faster on the last lap.
2018-07-29T13:37:06Z: Grosjean is now just 0.7s behind Hulkenberg in 10th place.
2018-07-29T13:36:52Z: Bottas will be with the yet-to-stop Gasly for third very soon.
2018-07-29T13:36:38Z: Raikkonen breezes past Magnussen to take fifth into Turn 1. He's 6.3s behind Bottas ahead now.
2018-07-29T13:36:22Z: Gasly is temporarily up to a glorious third as the leaders pit.
2018-07-29T13:35:50Z: Raikkonen is quickly catching Magnussen for fifth.
2018-07-29T13:35:34Z: And indeed Ricciardo does take seventh from Sainz at Turn 1. That was very late - it initially looked like the Red Bull couldn't catch the works Renualt car with the same power.
2018-07-29T13:35:23Z: Hamiltion bangs in another fastest lap of 1m22.539s and is now 8.7s ahead of Vettel.
2018-07-29T13:34:47Z: Bottas also goes from ultrasofts to softs, he manages to get out in fourth ahead of Magnussen.
2018-07-29T13:34:43Z: Ricciardo is right with Sainz - a Turn 1 attack is probably coming.
2018-07-29T13:34:29Z: Mercedes reacts to Ferrari's pitstop and brings Bottas in from second.
2018-07-29T13:33:58Z: Raikkonen goes from ultrasofts to softs, but there's a slightly sticky rear wheel and he falls to sixth behind Gasly and Magnussen.
2018-07-29T13:33:12Z: Raikkonen dives into the pits from fourth.
2018-07-29T13:32:56Z: Hamilton does another new fastest lap of 1m22.783s and gets his lead up to 6.5s over Bottas.
2018-07-29T13:32:35Z: And Ricciardo has passed Hartley for P8 at, you guessed it, the inside of Turn 1 with a late move.
2018-07-29T13:32:14Z: Some team radio has revealed that Perez was ordered to give Ricciardo a place back, for overtaking the Red Bull off the track at Turn 6 in the opening laps. Both drivers unhappy with what happened - in shock twist.
2018-07-29T13:31:06Z: Ricciardo attacks Hulkenberg at Turn 1 and takes ninth - that's a bit of a Ricciardo specialty, the late move into the right-hander.
2018-07-29T13:30:51Z: Vettel does his best lap of the day so far, but it's still a couple of tenths slower that what leader Hamilton did at the same time.
2018-07-29T13:30:11Z: Lap 11 of 70 now, and Hamilton's lead is up to 5.5s over Bottas, 7.3s over Vettel and 9.1s over Raikkonen.
2018-07-29T13:29:17Z: Next up for Ricciardo: Nico Hulkenberg, who is just 1.6s ahead of the Red Bull driver in ninth.
2018-07-29T13:29:12Z: An unimpressed Raikkonen is quizzing Ferrari over whether his drinks supply is working. The team admits it isn't. That's going to be tough in the boiling hot weather.
2018-07-29T13:28:43Z: Ricciardo dives by Grosjean at Turn 1, he seizes P10.
2018-07-29T13:27:53Z: Ricciardo is homing in on Grosjean - he's now just 0.6s behind the Haas driver's 10th place.
2018-07-29T13:27:10Z: The closest scrap in the field is between the Force India drivers - Perez, on ultrasofts, is just 0.5s behind Ocon, who is on softs.
2018-07-29T13:26:22Z: Gasly is already eight seconds behind Raikkonen in fourth place.
2018-07-29T13:25:37Z: Ricciardo passes Alonso for 11th at Turn 1 - Alonso thinks about a fightback but has to give way.
2018-07-29T13:24:28Z: A look back at the first lap
2018-07-29T13:24:08Z: Ricciardo attacks Alonso in the early part of the lap.
2018-07-29T13:23:41Z: With the VSC quickly cleared, the lead group is now: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas +3.8s; 3 Vettel +5.4s; 4 Raikkonen +6.8s
2018-07-29T13:23:15Z: Ericsson moved onto the medium tyres, which Stroll, now 17th, is also using.
2018-07-29T13:23:05Z: We'd love to bring you what Verstappen said about that problem, but the radio tirade had so many words bleeped out there was nothing left to transcribe.
2018-07-29T13:22:48Z: Ericsson pits from 17th, he drops to last.
2018-07-29T13:21:54Z: Verstappen was accelerating out of Turn 1 when his Red Bull-Renault suddenly faded.
2018-07-29T13:21:37Z: The virtual safety car is deployed while Verstappen's car is tidied away.
2018-07-29T13:21:22Z: Verstappen parks his car, race over for the top Red Bull after just five laps.
2018-07-29T13:21:00Z: Ricciardo passes Vandoorne for P13 at Turn 1.
2018-07-29T13:19:53Z: Ricciardo ran wide as he attacked Vandoorne at the downhill left of Turn 3.
2018-07-29T13:19:40Z: Hamilton is storming clear at the moemnt, his lead is up to 3.2s over Bottas after lap four.
2018-07-29T13:19:31Z: Ricciardo doesn't seem to have suffered any damage from the touch with Ericsson - he's up to 14th and fighting Vandoorne for P13.
2018-07-29T13:18:35Z: Start replays show how strong Vettel's first few corners were - he came very close to Sainz off the line but then carried a load of speed through Turn 1 and put a brilliant outside-line move on Raikkonen at Turn 2. He had half a look at Bottas there too.
2018-07-29T13:18:16Z: Replays show that Ericsson clattered into Ricciardo's front left tyre at Turn 1 - wheel to wheel.
2018-07-29T13:16:18Z: Hamilton brings his lead up to 1.6s on lap two, with Vettel 3s off the lead in third now and Raikkonen tagging along with him. Verstappen is looking a touch lonely in fifth.
2018-07-29T13:16:11Z: Ricciardo has confirmed to Red Bull that he had contact to his left-front on the opening lap.
2018-07-29T13:15:10Z: Hamilton completes lap one 1.1s clear of Bottas and 2.1s ahead of Vettel.
2018-07-29T13:15:08Z: Sainz also a big loser on lap one - he's gone from challenging Vettel at Turn 1 to eighth.
2018-07-29T13:14:57Z: Verstappen made up all the places he needed to from his poor qualifying by going down the inside at Turn 1, where it looked like he had a near-miss with Sainz that sent the Renault wide.
2018-07-29T13:14:38Z: Hulkenberg has charged up to 10th, while Ricciardo has dropped to 16th.
2018-07-29T13:14:05Z: It's Hamilton from Bottas, Vettel, Raikkonen, Verstappen and then Gasly and Magnussen, with Sainz falling to eighth.
2018-07-29T13:13:42Z: Vettel fends off Sainz, and then goes around the outside of Raikkonen to grab third.
2018-07-29T13:13:26Z: Vettel is under pressure from Sainz at the start, as Hamilton keeps the lead and Bottas slots behind him.
2018-07-29T13:11:02Z: So Ferrari has split its strategy - Raikkonen mirrors the Mercedes duo on the ultrasofts, with Vettel set to run longer in the first stint on the softs.
2018-07-29T13:10:04Z: Alonso, Ricciardo, Hulkenberg, Vandoorne, Leclerc, Ocon and Sirotkin are also on the soft tyres, while Stroll is taking his pit lane start on the medium rubber.
2018-07-29T13:09:07Z: Vettel and Sainz are the only top 10 runners to start on the soft tyres.
2018-07-29T13:07:52Z: Here’s the full line-up with less than five minutes to go until lights out1 Hamilton2 Bottas3 Raikkonen4 Vettel5 Sainz6 Gasly7 Verstappen8 Hartley9 Magnussen10 Grosjean11 Alonso12 Ricciardo13 Hulkenberg14 Ericsson15 Vandoorne16 Leclerc17 Ocon18 Perez19 Sirotkin20 Stroll (who starts from the pitlane)
2018-07-29T13:04:49Z: Bit of breaking news ahead of the race: Renault confirms that it is in talks with Esteban Ocon over a 2019 F1 drive and it expects to make a driver line-up decision by Spa Renault Formula 1 team confirms talks with Ocon for 2019 driveRenault has confirmed it is in talks to field Mercedes Formula 1 junior Esteban Ocon in 2019 and has targeted the Belgian Grand Prix to announce its driver line-up
2018-07-29T13:03:44Z: Because of the wet weather in qualifying, all the drivers are free to start on whatever tyres they want. Which means Ferrari, which was able to make the ultrasoft tyres last for longer on Friday, could opt to start one of its cars on the softer rubber, rather than the soft compound, in a bid to jump Mercedes off the line.
2018-07-29T13:03:12Z: The Ferrari is the quicker car in the dry and the hotter it gets the more Mercedes struggles with its tyres. But, it’s very hard to pass at the Hungaroring, so it will be fascinating to see whether Ferrari can find a way past the silver cars.
2018-07-29T13:02:55Z: So, Hamilton lines up ahead of his team-mate Valtteri Bottas, with the Ferrari drivers Kimi Raikkonen and Sebastian Vettel in third and fourth.
2018-07-29T13:02:31Z: Conditions could not be more different to yesterday’s wet qualifying session, which was topped by Lewis Hamilton and Mercedes.Under bright blue skies it is very hot at the Hungaroring, with an air temperature of 33C and a track temperature of 57C.The is a risk of rain, but it’s only 10% and seems unlikely to return today.
2018-07-29T13:01:19Z: We’re just under 10 minutes away from the start of the race.
2018-07-29T13:00:59Z: Welcome to Autosport’s live coverage of the 2018 Hungarian Grand Prix.
